title: Man City hold last Abu Dhabi training session | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share Before that, though, Pep Guardiola held a final training session in the second-largest city in the United Arab Emirates. The players seemed in fine spirits as they were put through their paces in the sweltering Middle Eastern sun. With a positive team spirit flowing through the side, there was also the welcome presence of injury hit Ilkay Gundogan on the sidelines. City's squad could also be seen taking part in one of Guardiola's preferred rondos during the session. Fernandinho (left) and Bacary Sagna were all smiles as they prepared for the session Pablo Zabaleta plays a pass during Saturday morning's session with Mikel Arteta watching Sergio Aguero - recently restored to the starting line-up - takes part in a training drill The Manchester club face a huge game against Monaco when they return to England and Yaya Toure fired out a warning to his team-mates about the difficulty they face at the Stade Louis II. 'We need to score two goals and we need to be careful â€“ the game is not finished,' the 33-year-old said. 'We have a game to play away in Monaco. We can't underestimate them.'
